abstract.p: Howard J Burnett letter on December 8 article holds New Jersey's Renewable Energy Grid Supply Program has potential for accelerating use of solar energy

block.p: ''Empowered By the Sun'' (Dec. 8) told only part of the story of New Jersey's leadership in ''reaping the sun.''
''Empowered By the Sun'' (Dec. 8) told only part of the story of New Jersey's leadership in ''reaping the sun.''

While the state's Clean Energy program shows great promise in spreading the solar energy gospel, a sister effort, the Renewable Energy Grid Supply Program, holds enormous potential for accelerating the use of solar as a supplement to fossil-fuel-generated electricity with all the inherent environmental benefits.

Under this program, our company, Stellar Energy Systems, of which I am chairman and chief executive, was recently awarded an incentive grant of $2.55 million by the state toward the $6 million cost of a project in which we will install and maintain solar systems on 20 to 25 commercial and institutional rooftops in the Long Beach Island Borough of Beach Haven at no cost to the property owners. The local utility and the rest of the community will benefit from the reduction of peak demand during high use times. Since this is primarily a summer resort area, the excess electricity generated by the systems for the better part of eight months will be sold into the power grid to other users. The object will be to replicate the concept throughout the rest of Long Beach Island and then in other New Jersey locations where we believe there is a potential of developing 100 megawatts of generating capacity.
